conclusion: Consider principles of shadow formation and relative positions of objects and light source.
Shadow A: Apple casts shadow directly below.
Shadow B: White object casts shadow directly below.
Shadow C: Transparent glass casts faint shadow directly below.
Shadow D: Chicken drumstick casts shadow directly below.
Shadows will shift and elongate in opposite direction of light source movement.
Shadow A will move towards front left of apple.
Shadow B will move towards front left of white object.
Shadow C will move towards front left of glass.
Shadow D will move towards front left of drumstick.
Shadows will become longer as light source moves further away.
Final answer: Shadows A, B, C, and D will shift towards front left and become longer.
